name: Old Fashioned
description: L'Old Fashioned est l'un des plus anciens cocktails connus. Sa simplicité met en valeur la qualité du whisky utilisé.
preparation_method: Dissoudre le sucre avec les bitters, ajouter le whisky, remuer avec de la glace, garnir du zeste d'orange

name: Cosmopolitan

tasting_notes.taste: Équilibre parfait entre acidité et douceur

serving_temperature: Très frais, sans glace dans le verre
description: Le Cosmopolitan est devenu iconique grâce à la série 'Sex and the City'. Ce cocktail élégant marie vodka et cranberry pour un résultat sophistiqué.
preparation_method: Mélanger tous les ingrédients au shaker avec de la glace, servir dans un verre à martini

name: Mojito Classique

tasting_notes.appearance: Transparent avec des feuilles de menthe
tasting_notes.taste: Rafraîchissant, mentholé avec une pointe d'acidité

serving_temperature: Très frais avec beaucoup de glace
description: Le mojito est un cocktail cubain traditionnel, parfait pour les chaudes journées d'été. Sa combinaison de menthe, rhum et citron vert en fait une boisson rafraîchissante emblématique.
preparation_method: Écraser la menthe avec le sucre, ajouter le rhum et le citron vert, compléter avec l'eau gazeuse

name: Gin tonic à la rhubarbe

tasting_notes.taste: Amer équilibré par l'acidité de la rhubarbe

description: Une variation moderne du gin tonic classique, avec la note acidulée distinctive de la rhubarbe qui apporte une dimension unique.
preparation_method: Mélanger le gin avec le sirop de rhubarbe, ajouter le tonic, garnir de rhubarbe fraîche et citron vert

name: Soda italien au citron et à la rhubarbe

tasting_notes.appearance: Rose pâle avec des morceaux de rhubarbe
tasting_notes.aroma: Acidulé, notes de rhubarbe et citron

serving_temperature: Très frais avec beaucoup de glace
description: Une boisson italienne traditionnelle parfaite pour l'été, combinant l'acidité de la rhubarbe avec la fraîcheur du citron italien.
preparation_method: Cuire la rhubarbe avec le sucre, laisser refroidir, mélanger avec le jus de citron et l'eau gazeuse, garnir de menthe

name: Seltzer au concombre et à la rhubarbe

tasting_notes.appearance: Transparent avec des morceaux de concombre

description: Une boisson saine et rafraîchissante, parfaite pour l'hydratation avec une combinaison originale de concombre et rhubarbe.
preparation_method: Écraser le concombre et la menthe, ajouter le sirop de rhubarbe, compléter avec l'eau gazeuse et le citron vert

name: Margarita sans alcool

tasting_notes.finish: Léger avec une pointe de sel

serving_temperature: Très frais avec beaucoup de glace
description: Version sans alcool de la célèbre Margarita mexicaine, tout aussi rafraîchissante et savoureuse que l'originale.
preparation_method: Mélanger le jus de citron vert avec le sirop d'agave, ajouter l'eau gazeuse, servir sur glace avec un rebord salé

name: Margarita sans alcool

tasting_notes.finish: Léger avec une pointe de sel

serving_temperature: Très frais avec beaucoup de glace
description: Version sans alcool de la célèbre Margarita mexicaine, tout aussi rafraîchissante et savoureuse que l'originale.
preparation_method: Mélanger le jus de citron vert avec le sirop d'agave, ajouter l'eau gazeuse, servir sur glace avec un rebord salé

name: Cajuína
description: La cajuína est une boisson traditionnelle du nord-est du Brésil, notamment populaire dans les États de Maranhão, Ceará et Piauí. Préparée à partir de pommes de cajou, elle est non alcoolisée, clarifiée et stérilisée, offrant une couleur jaune ambré due à la caramélisation des sucres naturels du fruit. Considérée comme un symbole culturel, elle est particulièrement emblématique de la ville de Teresina.

name: absinthe
description: Absinthe is a high-proof, anise-flavored spirit derived from botanicals like wormwood, anise, and fennel. Known as 'the green fairy,' it has a rich history and was once banned in many countries due to misconceptions about its effects. Today, absinthe is enjoyed worldwide in various cocktails and traditional preparations.

name: Thym Serpolet
description: Thym Serpolet is a floral mountain aperitif crafted entirely by Maison M Distillery. Made from wild thyme harvested in the French Alps, it offers a unique, sweet, and herbal flavor profile, making it ideal for refined cocktails and as a standalone drink.

name: Château Latour
description: Château Latour est un domaine viticole prestigieux situé à Pauillac, dans la région du Médoc, reconnu comme Premier Grand Cru Classé depuis la classification de 1855. Ce vin rouge d'exception est élaboré principalement à partir de Cabernet Sauvignon, offrant une structure dense et une capacité de vieillissement remarquable. ([fr.wikipedia.org](https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ch%C3%A2teau_Latour?utm_source=openai))

name: Chasselas

tasting_notes.aroma: Arômes discrets d'aubépine, de citron mûr, de menthe et de noisette.
tasting_notes.taste: Vin sec, léger, avec une acidité moyenne à élevée, offrant une sensation de fraîcheur.

description: Le Chasselas est un cépage blanc ancien, originaire de Suisse, principalement cultivé pour produire des vins blancs secs, légers et fruités. Il est également apprécié comme raisin de table, notamment sous l'appellation Chasselas de Moissac en France.

name: Gamay
description: Le Gamay est un cépage de raisin rouge principalement cultivé dans la région du Beaujolais, au sud de la Bourgogne, en France. Il est réputé pour produire des vins légers, fruités et floraux, souvent caractérisés par des arômes de cerise, de framboise et de violette. Le Gamay est également cultivé dans d'autres régions viticoles, notamment la Vallée de la Loire, le Canada, la Suisse, l'Australie et la Nouvelle-Zélande, où il donne des vins aux profils variés en fonction des terroirs.

name: Le Petit Lac Assemblage Blanc
description: Le Petit Lac Assemblage Blanc is a white wine from the Geneva region of Switzerland, produced by La Cave de Genève. This blend features Chardonnay, Pinot Gris, and Sauvignon Gris grapes, resulting in a wine with fruity aromas reminiscent of citrus fruits like lemon and grapefruit, complemented by subtle notes of quince and a gentle yeast character. On the palate, it offers a creamy and fresh structure, with hints of vanilla and a full-bodied finish that lingers pleasantly.

name: Le Petit Lac Assemblage Rouge Cave de Genève
description: Le Petit Lac Assemblage Rouge is a red wine from the Cave de Genève winery in Switzerland. This blend of Gamaret and Cabernet Franc grapes is partially aged in oak barrels, resulting in a wine with intense aromas of fine spices like nutmeg and cinnamon, complemented by red fruit notes such as cherry, plum, and blackberry. The palate is balanced and juicy, leading to a long, velvety finish.

name: Pinot Noir
description: A light-bodied red wine with flavors of red fruits like cherry and raspberry, balanced with earthy undertones and subtle spices.

name: Bordeaux
description: A full-bodied red wine, known for its complexity and depth, often featuring black currants, plum, and hints of cedar and leather.

name: Barolo
description: A robust and full-bodied red wine made from Nebbiolo grapes, known for its rich flavors of dark fruits, roses, and tar, with strong tannins and acidity.

name: Chasselas
description: Chasselas is a crisp, dry white wine known for its subtle notes of green apple and mineral nuances. It is often celebrated for its ability to reflect the terroir of its vineyard and is a staple in Switzerland.

name: Sauvignon Blanc de Touraine
description: This French Sauvignon Blanc from the Touraine region offers vibrant acidity with flavors of citrus, green herbs, and a hint of gooseberry. It’s a versatile wine that pairs beautifully with a variety of dishes.

name: Riesling Trocken
description: A dry German Riesling known for its bright acidity and ripe stone fruit flavors, complemented by floral notes. This wine exemplifies the quality of the Mosel region and is a great choice for any occasion.

name: Rheingold Lager
description: A crisp and refreshing lager with a delicate balance of malt and hops, offering a slight sweetness and a clean finish.

name: Château de Chillon Blonde
description: A golden ale from Switzerland featuring floral and fruity notes with a smooth finish, making it perfect for warm weather.

name: Birra Moretti
description: An authentic Italian lager that is well-balanced and has a touch of bitterness with a smooth aftertaste, brewed since 1859.

name: Pinot Noir
description: A light-bodied red wine known for its smooth tannins and red fruit flavors, particularly cherry and raspberry, with earthy undertones.

name: Merlot
description: A medium to full-bodied red wine with soft tannins, featuring flavors of plum, black cherry, and chocolate, making it an approachable wine.

name: Barolo
description: A robust and full-bodied wine made from Nebbiolo grapes, known for its complex aromas of tar, roses, and red fruit, with high acidity and tannins.

name: Zürcher Lager
description: A crisp and refreshing lager from Zurich, Zürcher Lager boasts a pale golden color with a light, malty flavor balanced by subtle hops. It's perfect for warm days and social gatherings.

name: Kölsch
description: This unique beer style originates from Cologne, Germany. Kölsch is a pale, delicate beer with a slightly fruity aroma and a crisp finish, brewed using top-fermenting yeast.

name: Birra Moretti
description: A traditional Italian lager that’s medium-bodied with a slightly hoppy taste, appearing light golden and with a pleasant malty character. Birra Moretti is a classic accompaniment for Italian meals.

name: Châteauneuf-du-Pape
description: A full-bodied red wine from the Southern Rhône in France, known for its complex flavors of dark fruits, herbs, and spices.

name: Barolo
description: Considered one of Italy's finest red wines, Barolo is made from Nebbiolo grapes and is known for its rich tannins and aging potential.

name: Pinot Noir from Valais
description: A distinctive Swiss red wine from the Valais region, characterized by its elegance and fruity notes, featuring cherries and raspberries, with a touch of minerality.

name: Chasselas
description: Chasselas is a dry white wine known for its subtle fruit flavors and floral aromas. It exhibits a soft mouthfeel with a hint of minerality, making it a quintessential Swiss wine, especially around Lake Geneva.

name: Sancerre
description: Sancerre is a renowned white wine from the Loire Valley in France, predominantly made from Sauvignon Blanc grapes. It offers a crisp acidity, vibrant citrus notes, and a minerality that pairs beautifully with seafood.

name: Riesling
description: German Riesling is celebrated for its aromatic intensity and versatility. Depending on the region, it can range from bone-dry to sweet, with flavors of peach, apricot, and honey, often balanced with crisp acidity.

name: Zürcher Lager
description: A crisp and refreshing lager brewed in Zurich, characterized by its light body and subtle malt sweetness with a clean finish.

name: Kölsch
description: A traditional pale ale from Cologne, Kölsch is known for its light golden color and delicate, fruity aroma, making it a perfect summer beer.

name: Birra di Natale
description: An Italian festive beer brewed with spices and a hint of sweetness, perfect for the holiday season, offering warmth and comfort in every sip.

name: Pinot Noir
description: A light to medium-bodied red wine with flavors of red fruits like cherry and raspberry, often accompanied by earthy undertones and herbal notes. Known for its finesse and complexity, it has a smooth texture and vibrant acidity, making it highly versatile.

name: Châteauneuf-du-Pape
description: A robust and full-bodied wine from the Southern Rhône Valley, characterized by rich flavors of blackberries, plums, and spices, complemented by a hint of leather and herbs. This wine exhibits a velvety mouthfeel and has substantial aging potential.

name: Barolo
description: Known as the 'King of Wines', Barolo is a powerful red wine made from Nebbiolo grapes, featuring bold tannins and complex aromas of rose petal, tar, and red fruits. It has a long aging potential, bringing out more nuanced flavors over time.

name: Chasselas
description: Chasselas is a white grape variety originating from Switzerland, particularly known for its versatility and subtle flavor profile. It's often characterized by floral and fruity notes, with a refreshing acidity and mineral undertones.

name: Chardonnay
description: French Chardonnay is renowned for its rich, full-bodied character, often featuring flavors of apple, pear, and citrus, along with buttery and toasty notes when aged in oak. This wine is celebrated for its smooth texture and versatility.

name: Riesling
description: German Riesling is a fragrant white wine known for its aromatic bouquet, often showing notes of green apple, peach, and floral accents. It ranges from dry to sweet, making it a popular choice for various palates.

name: Feldschlösschen Lager
description: A crisp and refreshing lager with a slight hoppy bitterness and a clean finish. It is one of the most popular beers in Switzerland, brewed with premium barley malt and hops.

name: Chimay Blue
description: A strong dark ale with rich flavors of dark fruits, caramel, and a hint of roasted malt. This beer is a Trappist ale brewed by Chimay in Belgium, known for its complex taste that develops over time.

name: Weihenstephaner Hefeweissbier
description: A traditional German wheat beer with a cloudy appearance and fruity notes of banana and clove, complemented by a smooth mouthfeel. It is brewed by Bayerische Staatsbrauerei Weihenstephan, the oldest brewery in the world.

name: Chianti
description: A classic Tuscan red wine made primarily from the Sangiovese grape, Chianti is known for its bright acidity, cherry flavors, and earthy notes. It is often aged in oak, which adds complexity and depth to its flavor profile.

name: Bordeaux
description: Bordeaux red wine is a blend primarily from Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, and Cabernet Franc grapes. This wine is renowned for its structure, tannins, and deep fruit flavors, often with notes of leather, tobacco, and cedar as it ages.

name: Rioja
description: Rioja is a Spanish red wine that is predominantly made from Tempranillo grapes. It is characterized by smooth tannins, cherry and plum flavors with hints of vanilla and spice from oak aging. It pairs well with a variety of foods.

name: Belgian Dubbel
description: A dark, rich beer with complex flavors of caramel, dark fruit, and a touch of spice, typical of traditional Belgian brewing.

name: German Pilsner
description: A crisp, refreshing beer with a light malt character and a pronounced hop bitterness, characterized by its pale color and golden clarity.

name: Irish Stout
description: A dark, almost black beer with roasted malt flavors and a creamy head, known for its smooth texture and hints of chocolate and coffee.

name: Chianti Classico
description: Chianti Classico is a red wine from Tuscany, known for its vibrant acidity and flavors of cherry, plum, and herbs. It is primarily made from the Sangiovese grape and is recognized for its unique terroir characteristics.

name: Bordeaux Red Blend
description: Bordeaux Red Blend is a classic French wine made from a blend of grape varieties like Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, and Cabernet Franc. It offers complex flavors of dark fruit, oak, and earthy undertones, representing the prestigious Bordeaux region.

name: Rioja Reserva
description: Rioja Reserva is a Spanish red wine from the Rioja region, typically aged for three years in oak barrels. It is known for its depth of flavor, with notes of vanilla, blackberry, and spice, making it a favorite among wine enthusiasts.

name: Pilsner Urquell
description: The world's first pale lager, known for its crisp, refreshing taste and light golden color. It is a bottom-fermented beer with a distinctive hoppy flavor.

name: Guinness Stout
description: A rich and creamy stout that is known for its deep black color and decadent taste of coffee and chocolate, with a smooth mouthfeel.

name: Weihenstephaner Hefeweissbier
description: A traditional German wheat beer with a fruity banana and clove aroma, known for its cloudy appearance and refreshing taste.

name: Chianti Classico
description: A medium-bodied red wine from Italy, known for its red cherry flavors, earthy notes, and balanced acidity. It is often aged in oak barrels which adds complexity and a slight spiciness to the taste.

name: Bordeaux Red Blend
description: This blend typically consists of Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, and Cabernet Franc. It is rich and full-bodied, showcasing dark fruit flavors like blackberry and plum, with herbal and tobacco undertones.

name: Rioja Reserva
description: A red wine from Spain's Rioja region, aged in oak for several years, resulting in a complex character with flavors of dark fruit, vanilla, and spice. It offers a smooth texture and a long finish.

name: Trappist Westvleteren 12
description: A rich, complex, dark Belgian ale with notes of dark fruit, caramel, and a surprisingly smooth finish.

name: Weihenstephaner Hefeweissbier
description: A classic German wheat beer that is refreshing and fruity, with flavors of banana and clove and a hazy golden appearance.

name: Guinness Draught
description: An iconic Irish stout known for its velvety texture and notes of roasted malt, coffee, and chocolate, with a creamy head.

name: Chianti Classico
description: A dry red wine from the Chianti region of Tuscany, Italy, characterized by its high acidity, firm tannins, and a flavor profile of red cherries, herbs, and a hint of earthiness.

name: Bordeaux Red Blend
description: A classic blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, and often a splash of Cabernet Franc, this wine exhibits aromas of blackcurrant, plum, and notes of cedar and tobacco due to oak aging.

name: Rioja Reserva
description: A Spanish red wine made primarily from Tempranillo grapes, aged for at least three years, resulting in complex flavors of dark fruit, leather, and vanilla.

name: Trappist Westvleteren 12
description: A rich, dark Belgian ale with a complex flavor profile, offering notes of dark fruit, caramel, and a hint of chocolate. Brewed by the Trappist monks of Westvleteren, it is known for its limited availability and high quality.

name: Pilsner Urquell
description: The world's first pale lager, Pilsner Urquell is crisp and refreshing with a blend of malt sweetness and hop bitterness. Its golden hue and slight carbonation make it a favorite among beer enthusiasts.

name: Weihenstephaner Hefeweissbier
description: This traditional German wheat beer features a cloudy, golden appearance with aromas of banana and clove. It has a smooth mouthfeel and a refreshing finish, making it a classic representation of the Hefeweizen style.

name: Chianti Classico
description: Chianti Classico is a full-bodied red wine from the Chianti region of Italy, primarily made from Sangiovese grapes. Known for its high acidity, earthy notes, and flavors of cherries, violets, and spice, it is a classic representation of Tuscan winemaking.

name: Bordeaux
description: Bordeaux is a renowned red wine from the Bordeaux region of France, typically a blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, and Cabernet Franc. It features rich tannins, complex layers of dark fruit, oak, and spice, making it a favorite among wine lovers.

name: Rioja
description: Rioja is a prestigious wine from the La Rioja region of Spain, predominantly made from Tempranillo grapes. This wine is known for its balanced structure, flavors of cherry and vanilla, and hints of leather and earthiness, often aged in oak barrels.

name: Pilsner Urquell
description: The world's first pale lager, brewed since 1842 in Plzeň, Czech Republic. It is known for its rich flavor, refreshing bitterness and golden color.

name: Heineken
description: A pale lager beer with a slightly bitter taste, brewed by Heineken N.V. since 1864 in Amsterdam, Netherlands. It has a crisp, refreshing flavor and is one of the most recognizable beers worldwide.

name: Guinness
description: An iconic Irish stout, renowned for its creamy head and rich, dark color. Brewed in Dublin, Ireland since 1759, it offers a unique blend of bitterness and sweetness.

name: Chianti
description: A well-known Italian red wine from the Chianti region, characterized by its bright acidity and cherry flavors, often with earthy and herbal notes.

name: Bordeaux
description: A famous French red wine blend, primarily made from Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot grapes. It offers a complex profile of dark fruits, tobacco, and cedar.

name: Tempranillo
description: A Spanish red wine varietal known for its smooth body and flavors of cherry, plum, and vanilla. It's often aged in oak barrels, adding complexity.

name: Pilsner Urquell
description: Pilsner Urquell is a classic Czech lager known for its rich golden color, clear appearance, and crisp, refreshing taste. It's the world’s first pale lager, brewed in Plzeň since 1842, offering a balanced bitterness from Saaz hops and a bready malt flavor.

name: Guinness
description: Guinness is an iconic Irish stout famous for its dark color and creamy white head. It has a rich, roasted flavor complemented by notes of chocolate and coffee, making it a beloved choice in pubs around the world since 1759.

name: Weihenstephaner Hefeweissbier
description: Weihenstephaner Hefeweissbier is a traditional Bavarian wheat beer that is incredibly refreshing with fruity and spicy flavors. Brewed by the oldest brewery in the world, it features notes of banana and clove with a smooth mouthfeel.

name: Chianti
description: A classic Italian red wine known for its high acidity and firm tannins, often featuring flavors of cherry and earthy notes.

name: Bordeaux Red Blend
description: A prestigious French wine blend, typically dominated by Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon, offering deep fruit flavors and a velvety texture.

name: Rioja
description: A richly flavored Spanish red wine known for its balance of fruit and oak, with notes of vanilla and cherry, often from Tempranillo grapes.

name: Chianti Classico
description: A famous Italian red wine known for its smooth tannins and cherry notes, often with a hint of earthy flavors and spice, typically aged in oak barrels.

name: Bordeaux Red Blend
description: A prestigious French wine blend, often comprised of Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, and Cabernet Franc, noted for its depth, structure, and aging potential, with flavors of dark fruits and cedar.

name: Rioja Reserva
description: A renowned Spanish red wine that is aged for a minimum of three years, known for its balance of oak and fruit flavors, showing typical notes of cherry, vanilla, and leather.

name: Heineken
description: A pale lager beer with a slightly bitter taste and a light body, known for its crisp finish.

name: Guinness Stout
description: A dark Irish stout known for its rich, creamy texture and flavors of coffee and chocolate.

name: Pilsner Urquell
description: The world’s first pale lager, known for its balanced richness and a gentle bitterness, produced in Plzeň.

name: Chianti Classico
description: A medium-bodied red wine with firm tannins and a vibrant acidity, featuring flavors of cherry, plum, and hints of earthy spices.

name: Rioja Reserva
description: A full-bodied red wine from Spain with layers of dried fruit flavors, vanilla, and oaky notes, well-structured with a long finish.

name: Bavarian Hefeweizen
description: A traditional German wheat beer with a refreshing taste and fruity notes of banana and clove, resulting from the use of top-fermenting yeast.

name: Bordeaux Blend
description: A rich and complex red wine made from a blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot, showcasing dark fruit flavors, cedar, and fine tannins.

name: Dunkel Lager
description: A dark German lager characterized by its rich malt flavor, with hints of caramel and a smooth, slightly sweet finish.

name: Belgian Tripel
description: A robust golden ale with a strong fruity aroma and a complex flavor profile that includes notes of spices and a slightly sweet finish.

name: Trappist Westvleteren 12
description: A rich and complex dark ale, Westvleteren 12 features notes of dark fruits, toffee, and chocolate, making it a highly sought-after brew from the Saint Sixtus Abbey.

name: Weihenstephaner Hefeweissbier
description: The world's oldest brewery presents this classic Hefeweizen, known for its banana and clove flavors, smooth mouthfeel, and hazy golden appearance.

name: Guinness Draught
description: An iconic Irish stout, known for its dark color and creamy head, with flavors of roasted barley and hints of coffee and caramel.

name: Château Lafite Rothschild
description: A prestigious Bordeaux wine known for its elegance and complexity, featuring notes of blackcurrant, cedar, and subtle tobacco.

name: Barolo
description: Often referred to as the 'King of Wines', Barolo is a full-bodied red wine from Piedmont, offering rich flavors of cherries, truffles, and roses.

name: Tempranillo
description: A classic Spanish red wine with a smooth texture, Tempranillo showcases flavors of cherry, plum, and vanilla, typically aged in oak barrels.

name: Pilsner Urquell
description: The world's first pale lager, known for its golden color and refreshing bitterness, with a slight sweetness from the malt.

name: Heineken
description: A pale lager beer with a mild, balanced taste and slight bitterness, known for its refreshing qualities and consistent quality.

name: Bordeaux

name: Rioja

name: Guinness Draught

name: Weihenstephaner Hefeweissbier

name: Chianti Classico
description: A classic Italian red wine from the Tuscany region, Chianti Classico is known for its Sangiovese grape and offers aromas of cherry, plum, and violet with earthy undertones and bright acidity.

name: Bordeaux Red Blend
description: This prestigious French wine is a blend primarily made from Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot grapes. It boasts rich flavors of blackberry, currant, and a hint of oak, making it a favorite for aging.

name: Rioja Reserva

name: German Pilsner
description: A crisp and refreshing lager known for its light golden color and balanced hop bitterness. It originated in the city of Pilsen, Czech Republic and has a clean finish.

name: Belgian Dubbel
description: A rich and malty beer with notes of dark fruit, caramel, and toffee. This traditional Belgian ale is known for its deep amber color and complex flavor profile.

name: Irish Stout
description: A dark, rich beer known for its strong coffee and chocolate flavors, with a creamy head. Most famously represented by Guinness, it has a smooth mouthfeel and low bitterness.

name: Chianti
description: A classic Italian red wine known for its bright acidity and flavors of cherry, earthy notes, and a hint of spice.

name: Bordeaux
description: A prestigious wine from the Bordeaux region, characterized by its deep flavors of dark fruit, cedar, and tobacco, often with a complex structure.

name: Rioja
description: A Spanish red wine from the Rioja region, known for its bold flavors of ripe fruits, vanilla, and spice, influenced by oak aging.

name: Pilsner Lager
description: A pale golden lager with a crisp, refreshing taste and a floral aroma, known for its balance of malt sweetness and hop bitterness.

name: Belgian Dubbel
description: A strong dark ale with rich malt flavors, notes of caramel, dark fruit, and a slight spiciness, typically brewed by Trappist monks.

name: IPA (India Pale Ale)
description: A hoppy beer style known for its strong hop flavor, bitterness, and fruity aroma; often citrusy or piney in character.

name: Chianti Classico
description: A medium-bodied red wine with bright acidity and soft tannins, featuring flavors of cherry, plum, and earthy notes.

name: Bordeaux Red Blend
description: A complex wine characterized by its balance, with dark fruit flavors, floral aromas, and a hint of minerality, typically consisting of Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot grapes.

name: Rioja Crianza
description: A smooth red wine with notes of ripe strawberries, soft oak, and vanilla, aged for a minimum of one year in oak barrels and two years in bottle.

name: German Pilsner
description: A crisp, refreshing lager with a golden color, German Pilsners are known for their hoppy aroma and a clean, light body. They offer a perfect balance of malt sweetness and bitter hops, making them a staple of German brewing.

name: Belgian Dubbel
description: Rich and malty, Belgian Dubbels are dark brown ales that feature notes of caramel, dark fruit, and a warming alcohol presence. They are traditionally brewed by Trappist monks and have a complex flavor profile with a slightly sweet finish.

name: British IPA
description: British Indian Pale Ales are characterized by their strong hop flavor, moderate bitterness, and a fruity estery note. Originally brewed for export to India, they have become popular across the UK, maintaining a solid malt backbone to balance the hops.

name: Chianti Classico
description: A bold Italian red wine known for its bright acidity and flavors of cherry, plum, and subtle herbal notes. Chianti Classico is typically made from Sangiovese grapes and is characterized by its vibrant red color and medium body.

name: Bordeaux Blend
description: A renowned French red wine originating from the Bordeaux region, typically a blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, and Cabernet Franc. It exhibits rich flavors of dark fruit, tobacco, and cedar, with a full body and firm tannins.

name: Rioja Reserva
description: A sophisticated Spanish red wine from the Rioja region, this reserva is aged in oak barrels for several years, resulting in a complex flavor profile of ripe berries, vanilla, and spice. It is smooth and well-balanced, making it a favorite among wine lovers.

name: Pilsner Urquell
description: A classic Czech pale lager, known for its golden color, crisp taste, and distinct bitterness from Saaz hops.

name: Trappistes Rochefort 10
description: A rich and complex Belgian Dubbel Ale, which is dark and malty with notes of dark fruit, caramel, and toffee.

name: Weihenstephaner Hefeweissbier
description: A traditional German Hefeweizen with a cloudy appearance, featuring banana and clove notes from the fermentation process.
